Type: Low-impact aerobic (brisk walking, cycling, elliptical, aquatic)
Parkinson-specific skill work (boxing-style drills, high-amplitude BIG moves)
RestPeriod: Try not to exceed 24 h between sessions to sustain neuro-protective benefits
Progression: Add 5 min per session every 2 weeks until 60 min is reached, provided no increase in freezing or fatigue
Supervision: Schedule initial sessions during your medication “on” time with a Parkinson-specialised physiotherapist
Equipment: Metronome or smartphone app for cadence cues

Type: Progressive resistance training (8–10 major muscle groups)
Progression: Increase load 5–10 % once 12 reps can be performed with good form and no exacerbation of tremor
Supervision: Learn joint-safe technique and bracing from a certified trainer familiar with PD
Equipment: Weight machines with upright back support

Type: Balance & agility (tai chi, tandem walk, obstacle steps)
Flexibility stretching (hip flexors, calves, thoracic rotation)
Progression: Reduce hand support, add dual-task cues or eyes-closed stance as stability improves
Supervision: Exercise in a clutter-free area; have a stable support rail or partner spot
